intro: Conradia cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf conradia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sedges. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Conradia cuneifolia thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
